definition: to send away/to deport/to repatriate
to dispatch/to send/to dispel
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to deport

sentences.english: And when the morning arose, they were sent away with their asses.
sentences.chinese: 清早天一發亮，就遣送這些人帶着他們的驢走了。

sentences.english: During the voyage, he was terribly seasick and deported back to his home ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 因航行途中暈船厲害，被提前遣送回鄉。

sentences.english: He was sent down to earth to help men at the plough.
sentences.chinese: 他被遣送到地球，幫助人類犁耕。

sentences.english: Out organization has effectuated the return to their countries of all the political prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 我們的組織已達成遣送所有政治犯回國。

sentences.english: He was sent home straight away.
The soldier was invalided home because of the wounds he received.
sentences.chinese: 這位戰士因負傷而被遣送回家。

sentences.english: The kids of the 10 Russian spies, some born in the US, opted for repatriation.
sentences.chinese: 一些孩子出生在美國，但他們選擇遣送回國。

sentences.english: Involuntary repatriation of Haitians began this week.
sentences.chinese: 這周已開始將海地人強制遣送回國。

sentences.english: G4S operates the Centres on behalf of the United Kingdom Border Agency.
sentences.chinese: G4S代表英國國家邊境署經營該等移民遣送中心。

sentences.english: They're being sent to siena to await exchange .
sentences.chinese: 他們正被遣送到錫耶納去等候交換。

sentences.english: It's worth getting a small wound to be invalided home.
sentences.chinese: 能被遣送回國，受點輕傷也值得的。

sentences.english: The parking deck had to be removed after a section collapsed and made the building unsafe.
sentences.chinese: 停車後甲板已被遣送了一段坍塌的建築物和不安全。

sentences.english: He says the migrants can request asylum or accept voluntary repatriation.
sentences.chinese: 他說，移民可以要求收容或者接受自願遣送回國。

sentences.english: The newspaper said that a few fifth Coloumn were repatriated several days ago.
sentences.chinese: 根據報紙報道幾天前幾個間諜被遣送回國。

definition: to repatriate (e.g. prisoners of war)/to send back
to deport/to expel
to send away to serve a penal sentence
to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
to arrest/to take into custody
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
to imprison/to take into custody
to deport
in custody/to keep sb in detention
illegal immigration/to stowaway (on a ship)/to steal across the international border/to run a blockade
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
house arrest
to complete a prison sentence
to escort a criminal under guard (in former times)
to arrest
